intro: Bidens hyperborea var. arcuans, commonly known as the Arctic ironweed, is a perennial herb native to arctic and alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges and thrives in cold, nutrient-poor soils. It is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. The flowers are typically arranged in clusters and are visited by various pollinators, including bees and flies.
